text: Because, if one is writing novels today, concentrating on the beauty of the prose is right up there with concentrating on your semi-colons, for wasted effort.
author: Neil Gaiman

text: As soon as beauty is sought not from religion and love, but for pleasure, it degrades the seeker.
author: Annie Dillard

text: Beauty is an outward gift which is seldom despised, except by those to whom it has been refused.
author: Edward Gibbon

text: Beauty is often worse than wine intoxicating both the holder and beholder.
author: John Zimmerman

text: All the freaky people make the beauty of the world.
author: Michael Franti
